title: Drawing, "Design for Best Products Showroom, "Notch" Project", 1975
medium: Pen and black ink on white wove paper
signed: Signed in pen and black ink, lower right: Wines / SITE, Inc. 1975
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink, lower left: BEST PRODUCTS SHOWROOM – ‘NOTCH’ PROJECT
description: Elevation of a building with seven drawings in registers across paper. At the top, finished building, cube structure with bricks showing at one corner leading to a large section missing; glass inserted here for glass entrance. Below this, register of four designs of the building, showing from right to left the removal of one corner of the cube to create the entrance, with notations: NOTCH CLOSING GAP; BEGINNING OF NOTCH REMOVAL; DEMOLITION NOTCH REMOVAL; COMPLETION OF NOTCH / REMOVAL AND DEMOLITION / OF POSITIVE UNIT. Lower register with two designs; left: TEMPORARY DOLLY MOUNTING / FOR NOTCH REMOVAL; right: POSITIVE UNIT AS / A MONUMENT. The positive notch is placed next to the finished building.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Design for Best Products Showroom, "Notch" Project", 1975. Pen and black ink on white wove paper. Gift of James Wines. 1976-16-1.
